> The methods that I most want to test are often the ones I want to
> declare as private. That makes them inaccessible to my testing
> harness.

You should search the archive. Tons of mails about this subject have been
exchanged. But to summarize: 

- JUnit is not designed to test private methods (so your installation is OK) 
- test your private methods via public or protected ones 
- write your TestCase as inner class 
- use an helper class that modifies the access specifier on the fly 
- refactor your code and place your private methods into another
public/protected class Like I said, more info in the archive 

-Vladimir
